description: Second pass of intellectual genealogy: scans a single prior work for genealogical traces of target ideas from the current work. This pass runs ONCE PER PRIOR WORK. The workflow orchestrator loops over prior works and calls this pass for each.
researcher_question: What traces of these ideas can be found in this prior work, and in what form do they appear?

prior_work_info.title: string - title of the prior work being scanned
prior_work_info.context: string - what this work was about and its intellectual context

traces_found.target_idea_name: string - name of the target idea for readability
traces_found.description: string - how this idea appears in the prior work

textual_evidence.quote: string - direct quote from the prior work
textual_evidence.location: string - approximate location in the prior work

traces_found.notable_differences: string - how the prior version differs from the current version
traces_found.function_in_prior_work: string - what role this idea played in the prior argument

ideas_not_found.idea_id: string - target idea_id not found in this prior work
ideas_not_found.idea_name: string - name of the absent idea
ideas_not_found.significance_of_absence: string - what it means that this idea wasn't present yet

new_discoveries.discovery: string - ideas in the prior work that are relevant but weren't in our target list
new_discoveries.relevance: string - why this discovery matters for the genealogical analysis

meta.coverage_ratio: number (0-1) - fraction of target ideas found in some form
key_findings: string - notable observations about this prior work's relationship to the current work

extraction.core_question: What traces of the target ideas exist in this prior work?
extraction_steps: RECEIVE TARGET IDEAS: Review the list of ideas extracted from the current work (provided as context from Pass 1)
SCAN FOR EACH IDEA: Systematically search the prior work for traces of each target idea

CLASSIFY FORM: For each trace found, determine its form — is it a proto-form (early version), full form (already mature), contradictory form (opposite position), or different framing (same concept, different context)?
ASSESS DIFFERENCES: Note how the prior version differs from the current version in substance, emphasis, scope, or framing
DOCUMENT FUNCTION: Record what role this idea played in the prior work's argument
NOTE ABSENCES: Record ideas from the target list that are NOT present and assess the significance
DISCOVER NEW CONNECTIONS: Flag ideas in the prior work that are relevant to the genealogy but weren't in the target list

key_fields.trace_id: Unique identifier for each genealogical trace
key_fields.form_in_prior_work: How the idea manifests in the prior work
key_fields.confidence: How confident we are in this trace

extraction.special_instructions: Be precise about the FORM of each trace. A proto-form is an early, less developed version. A contradictory form means the author held the opposite position. Different framing means the same basic concept appears but serving a different argument. Do not force connections — if an idea truly isn't present, document its absence.

consolidation_rules: Flag contradictory forms as high priority for evolution analysis

id_examples.to: Proto-form of 'functional economy' in earlier automation analysis

concretization.naming_guidance: Use trace form + target idea name
